pageContext.claim: “And we then did the war on clean, beautiful coal, and we are putting -- and you see it better than almost anybody -- our coal miners. They're all back to work, and they're going back to work.”
pageContext.analysis: This is mostly baloney. The U.S. has added 2,300 coal mining jobs, or a gain of 4.5 percent, since Trump took office, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics. That's a drop in the bucket when measured against the 125,000-job loss in this industry since its most recent peak in 1985, or the 36,000-job loss since 2012.
